result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Kwitek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Parties stipulate to cash seized from defendant's bedroom may be used to pay fines and restitution, balance to be returned to defendant.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Kwitek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: face sheet intake and investigation

9:30 am - Defendant Michael A. Kwitek appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement. DA moves to amend to 943.34(1)(a) Misd. A. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court orders amendment.   DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to charge.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:43 am.
Court imposes (Ct. 1):
Sentence withheld - 1 year probation.
Conditions:
$350 fine
$7000 + 10% surcharge Restitution
Apology
Parties stipulate to cash seized from defendant's bedroom may be used to pay fines and restitution, balance to be returned to defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 09:30 am
Jury trial at 12-03-2015 09:00 am

10:00 am - Defendant Michael A. Kwitek appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by DA regarding previous hearing and motions.  Comments by Atty. Willett. Atty. Willett states there are no Miranda-Goodchild issues.  Stipulation of the parties regarding Miranda-Goodchild issues.  So ordered. Court comments regarding warrant and cash seizure. Ronald Glaman called and sworn. Direct by DA. Cross by Atty. Willett. Redirect. Argument by DA. Rebuttal by Atty. Willett. Comments and ruling by Court.  Court states warrant was appropriate and denies motion. Adj. 10:37 am.
Defendant's brief in support of motion to suppress
Motion hearing at 07-20-2015 10:00 am

10:00 am - Defendant Michael A. Kwitek appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by DA regarding motions. Exam by Court. Comments regarding statements made by Attorney Willett. Hearing to be set on miranda issues. Comments regarding motion on search by Attorney Willett. Comments by DA.  Comments by Attorney Willett. Rebuttal by DA. Comments and ruling by Court.  Court defers resolution of issue until testimony of agent. Adj. 10:28 am.
Motion hearing at 05-27-2015 10:00 am
Preliminary hearing on 10-21-14
see minutes on today's date under preliminary hearing event

1:44 pm - Defendant Michael A. Kwitek in court with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Loreen Glaman called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty. Willett.  Redirect.  Recross.  Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial.  DA files information.  Parties have received and reviewed.  DE pleads NOT GUILTY to charges.  Atty. Willett request extension of time to file motions after discovery for 30 days after receipt of discovery.  Court grants.  Adj.  2:18 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant's motion to suppress fruits of illegal search of premises

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:09 am - Defendant Michael A. Kwitek appeared with attorney Stephen D Willett.  Mark T Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Plea of Not Guilty and Demand for Twelve-Person Jury Trial
